Sentencas: In this study, with the motivation of elucidating the effect of H2S and HCl on solid oxide fuel cell anodes, nickel and ceria pattern anodes are prepared on yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte, and the effect of H2S and HCl on their performance is tested using electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Effect of H2S and HCl contaminants on nickel and ceria pattern anode solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, it has been found that while H2S adversely impacts both nickel and ceria, the poisoning caused is reversible for nickel and only partially reversible for ceria.
Titulo: Effect of H2S and HCl contaminants on nickel and ceria pattern anode solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Poisoning kinetics are similar and fast for both materials, while recovery kinetics are slower for ceria than nickel.
Titulo: Effect of H2S and HCl contaminants on nickel and ceria pattern anode solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: High sulfur coverage is the rate-limiting factor inferred from the elementary kinetic modeling.
Titulo: Effect of H2S and HCl contaminants on nickel and ceria pattern anode solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Unlike H2S, the presence of HCl appeared to be favorable for electrochemical oxidation as the polarization resistance of both pattern electrode cells decreased upon feeding HCl contaminated hydrogen gas.
Titulo: Effect of H2S and HCl contaminants on nickel and ceria pattern anode solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Similar behavior has not been reported previously, and the conclusion regarding underlying mechanisms requires further investigation.
Titulo: Effect of H2S and HCl contaminants on nickel and ceria pattern anode solid oxide fuel cells
